name: Respond to Gaia task
definition: Handle Gaia-related queries and tasks by generating appropriate responses based on Gaia task instructions.

name: Process file upload
definition: Receive and acknowledge file uploads by extracting and displaying metadata such as file name, file type, and file size, and processing the document if needed.

name: Create long-running task
definition: Initiate a new long-running task with capabilities for subsequent progress tracking and output artifact generation.

name: Monitor task progress
definition: Track and report real-time updates on the progress of a multi-step long-running task.

name: Generate task artifact
definition: Produce output artifacts from a task in various formats including markdown, HTML, and image, as part of task completion.

name: Cancel running task
definition: Terminate an ongoing long-running task by issuing a cancellation command.

name: Collect academic signals
definition: Acquires academic data and signals based on specified dates or research queries to initiate the signal processing workflow.

name: Interpret academic signals
definition: Analyzes and deciphers collected academic signals to extract meaningful insights and trends from the data.

name: Recommend academic content
definition: Identifies and suggests relevant academic papers or research topics based on the interpreted signals to guide scholarly inquiry.

name: Generate academic report
definition: Compiles and structures the outcomes of the signal processing workflow into a comprehensive academic report summarizing findings and recommendations.

name: Provide conversational assistance
definition: Engage in text-based conversation by answering questions, offering explanations, and providing general information in response to user queries.

name: Process file uploads
definition: Receive file uploads and extract file metadata such as name, type, and size to provide users with a summary of the uploaded file's details.

name: Manage long-running tasks
definition: Create, monitor, and control tasks that execute over a long period, including tracking progress, generating artifacts (markdown, HTML, image), and handling task cancellation.

name: Optimize User Prompt
definition: This capability refines a user-provided prompt to improve clarity, effectiveness, and overall quality of the AI's responses based on principles of prompt optimization.

name: Optimize System Prompt
definition: This capability enhances system prompts to better guide AI behavior and consistency, ensuring that the instructions foster a desired operational framework.

name: Iterative Prompt Optimization
definition: This capability allows for repeated improvements of a prompt based on specific feedback or additional context, ensuring that the prompt continuously evolves to meet performance goals.

name: Generate Mermaid diagram
definition: Generate Mermaid code for various diagram types such as flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and class diagrams based on input descriptions. The capability accepts a diagram specification as input and returns the corresponding Mermaid code.

name: Convert Mermaid code
definition: Convert provided Mermaid code into a visual diagram image, such as an SVG. The capability accepts Mermaid code as input and returns a rendered image of the diagram.

name: Validate Mermaid syntax
definition: Verify the correctness of Mermaid code by checking its syntax. The capability accepts Mermaid code as input and returns a validation result indicating whether the syntax is correct or provides error details.

name: Filter and recommend papers
definition: Accepts a JSON input containing an 'arxiv_ids' list. The capability fetches full metadata for these ArXiv papers, performs intelligent filtering, sorting, and ranking based on predefined internal logic or user instructions, and outputs a JSON list of up to 8 recommended ArXiv IDs in ranked order.

name: Extract IDs and recommend papers
definition: Accepts a natural language text input containing one or more ArXiv paper IDs. The capability extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the text, retrieves their full metadata, applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and ranking based on internal logic, and outputs a JSON list of up to 8 recommended ArXiv IDs in recommended order.

name: Analyze papers by ArXiv IDs
definition: Accepts a JSON object containing a list of ArXiv paper IDs. Retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, performs deep content analysis and summarization, and returns a JSON list where each entry is a Markdown formatted interpretation report of the paper.

name: Extract and analyze ArXiv papers from text
definition: Accepts a text string containing one or more ArXiv paper IDs. Automatically extracts valid IDs, retrieves the corresponding papers from the ArXiv platform, performs deep analysis and summarization, and returns a JSON list where each entry is a Markdown formatted interpretation report of the paper.

name: Analyze attached paper PDFs
definition: Accepts a message with one or more attached PDF files of scientific papers. Reads each attached file, performs deep content analysis and summarization, and returns a JSON list where each entry is a Markdown formatted interpretation report of the paper.

name: Download paper PDF
definition: This capability accepts a JSON input containing a list of ArXiv IDs, downloads the corresponding paper's PDF file for each ID, encodes each PDF into a Base64 string, and returns a JSON list of these encoded strings.

name: Extract IDs and download paper PDFs
definition: This capability accepts a natural language text input which may contain one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It extracts all valid ArXiv IDs from the text, downloads the corresponding PDF file for each extracted ID, encodes each PDF into a Base64 string, and returns a JSON list of these encoded strings.

name: Search Arxiv papers
definition: This capability accepts either a natural language instruction or a structured JSON query to search the Arxiv database for academic papers. It processes natural language inputs by converting them into a structured query, executes the search, and returns a JSON-formatted list of paper metadata (including titles, authors, abstracts, etc.).

name: Analyze research papers
definition: This capability analyzes provided academic research papers to extract potential research ideas and directions. It takes as input a collection of research papers and outputs a list of research insights that may include novel ideas, experimental directions, or emerging trends.

name: Identify research gaps
definition: This capability reviews academic literature to identify existing research gaps and unexplored areas in a given field. It processes input research articles and outputs a list of opportunities for further investigation or novel research directions.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts a natural language text query via the A2A protocol and searches academic databases, specifically arXiv and Semantic Scholar, for relevant papers. It returns a numbered list (up to 5 results) where each entry includes the paper title, authors with publication year, source identifier, a truncated abstract, and URLs with available PDF links.

name: Review PDF Paper
definition: Reviews an academic paper provided as a PDF file by extracting text and metadata, analyzing content, and generating a comprehensive review report with structured scoring for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance.

name: Review Paper from URL
definition: Reviews an academic paper given as a URL by automatically downloading the PDF, extracting text and metadata, and generating a detailed review report with structured scoring (1-10) for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: Handles greetings and inquiries by providing information about the agent's capabilities, available functions, and guidelines for effective usage.

name: Respond to text queries
definition: This capability processes text queries to provide helpful, clear, and concise responses by leveraging conversational AI and language model functions. It supports engaging in general discussion, answering questions, and offering explanations.

name: Process file uploads
definition: This capability acknowledges file uploads by receiving file inputs and extracting metadata such as file name, type, and size. It facilitates the display and processing of this file metadata for subsequent use.

name: Manage tasks
definition: This capability allows for the creation and control of long-running tasks by providing progress tracking, artifact generation in multiple formats (e.g., markdown, HTML, images), and cancellation support during task execution.

name: Browse web
definition: This capability enables an agent to browse the web to answer questions. It processes user queries by searching online for up-to-date information and returning relevant results, such as weather updates or topic-specific data.

name: Converse using LLMs
definition: This capability allows the agent to engage in natural language conversations using large language models. It can answer questions, provide explanations, generate summaries, and handle multi-turn dialogue to clarify and communicate complex topics.

name: Execute Python code
definition: This capability enables the agent to run arbitrary Python code snippets in a secure sandbox environment. It processes the code to produce standard output, generate visual plots, handle errors, and integrate the results back into the conversation.

name: Automate browser tasks
definition: This capability allows the agent to control a headless browser for web automation. It can navigate web pages, perform searches, click elements, extract web content, automate form filling, and take screenshots.

name: Integrate MCP tools
definition: This capability enables the agent to dynamically connect to remote MCP servers via SSE or stdio. It discovers, invokes, and refreshes remote tool schemas on-the-fly, allowing the integration of external service tools as if they were local.

name: Edit and transform text
definition: This capability empowers the agent to perform structured text editing and transformation, including find-and-replace operations, templating, formatting, and content modifications according to specified patterns or guidelines.

name: Terminate tasks and cleanup resources
definition: This capability provides the agent with the ability to gracefully terminate multi-step processes. It ensures the proper shutdown of ongoing tasks, the release of resources such as browser instances or MCP connections, and reports the final success or error status.
